description: Partial claviculectomy (includes Mumford procedure) is considered medically necessary when ALL of the following criteria are met. (Evidence: pg no: 17, L560-L561)
scope: This guideline addresses shoulder arthroscopy and open procedures when performed as an elective, non-emergent procedure and not as part of the care of an acute fracture. (Evidence: pg no: 12, L373-L374)

documentation: Pain at the acromioclavicular (AC) joint aggravated by shoulder motion (Evidence: pg no: 17, L562)
Positive cross-arm adduction test (Evidence: pg no: 17, L563)
Tenderness over the acromioclavicular joint (Evidence: pg no: 17, L564)
Imaging findings (x-ray or MRI) consistent with acromioclavicular joint arthritis (Evidence: pg no: 17, L565)
Failure of at least 12 weeks of conservative management (Evidence: pg no: 17, L569)

codes.description: Arthroscopy, shoulder, surgical; distal claviculectomy including distal articular surface (Evidence: pg no: 21, L735)

notes: For acromioclavicular arthritis. (Evidence: pg no: 17, L559)
